name: Vegan Carne Asada
description: Juicy, tender and full of flavor, this Vegan Carne Asada will blow you away!
recipeIngredient: 1/2 cup orange juice (fresh squeezed is best)
2 tablespoons fresh lime juice (from about 2 limes)
1  jalape√±o, minced, seeds removed for less heat

recipeInstructions.text: Make the seitan steak, but do not make the marinade with the recipe. Instead, use this carne asada marinade.
recipeInstructions.name: Make the seitan steak, but do not make the marinade with the recipe. Instead, use this carne asada marinade.

recipeInstructions.text: In a large ziplock type bag (wash and reuse after to reduce waste), add all marinade ingredients. Alternatively, use a container with a lid.
recipeInstructions.name: In a large ziplock type bag (wash and reuse after to reduce waste), add all marinade ingredients. Alternatively, use a container with a lid.

recipeInstructions.text: Once the steaks have steamed, cut them up into slices and add to the bag with the marinade.
recipeInstructions.name: Once the steaks have steamed, cut them up into slices and add to the bag with the marinade.

recipeInstructions.text: Seal and squish the bag around to coat. Let marinate in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours, overnight preferred, in the refrigerator.
recipeInstructions.name: Seal and squish the bag around to coat. Let marinate in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours, overnight preferred, in the refrigerator.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat a grill pan or cast iron pan over medium-high heat. Place the marinaded seitan steak pieces in the pan, saving the excess marinade. Cook for a few minutes on each side, until a bit blackened. Add a little more marinade right before removing from the pan, for extra flavor.

Cook for a few minutes on each side, until a bit blackened. Add a little more marinade right before removing from the pan, for extra flavor.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove from heat and serve in corn or flour tortillas with toppings of choice. I like chopped white onion, chopped cilantro and crumbled vegan feta (not traditional, but Violife's vegan feta reminds me of cotja cheese!) Enjoy!
